summary: During a debate in Milwaukee on March 31st, 2016, Ted Cruz claimed that President Obama did not prioritize the safety of the country after the terror attack in Brussels, as he continued playing baseball with communist dictators instead of addressing the issue.

During the debate in Milwaukee on March 31st, 2016, Ted Cruz criticized Donald Trump for suggesting that the head of the "National Enquirer" should take over "Time" Magazine. Anderson Cooper questioned Cruz's previous reluctance to go after Trump, citing a tweet from December where Cruz called Trump "terrific." Cruz responded by saying that he knew the media was engaged in a love fest with Trump, implying that he was not part of it.
